lines.text: Turn your thousand into a million; you can't lose without tryin'. It's all in the cards. Three-card monte, gentlemen. I want your money. The game's crooked, the cards are fixed, you can't win.
Engaged is maybe; married is done-done.
Spring never comes again, Ethan. Perhaps in the Indian Summer we'll meet once more.
She's not just news anymore - she's history!

[said to statue]
Forever, Ethan. No one can change it... forever.
Men were different in those days. Men like Ethan. A drink in one hand and luck in the other.
